title.narrative: CREATING SAFE SPACES FOR FREEDOM OF EXPRESSION ONLINE

description.narrative: Paradigm Initiative is a non-profit social enterprise that builds ICT-enabled support systems through our digital inclusion and digital rights program. Our digital rights program is focused on the development of public policy for internet freedom in key regions of Africa, with offices in Abuja, Nigeria; Yaoundé, Cameroon; Lome, Togo; Arusha, Tanzania; and Lusaka, Zambia. Our policy advocacy efforts include media campaigns, litigation, coalition building, training, research and report writing. We host the annual bilingual and pan-African Digital Rights and Inclusion Forum (formerly known as Internet freedom Forum) that brings online rights enthusiasts and experts from across 35 African countries. Paradigm Initiative also led the process of developing the Nigerian Digital Rights and Freedom Bill that now only awaits presidential assent. The organization has become a leading expert and go-to institution on the subject of online rights in Africa.

The objective of this project is to increase awareness and respect for online freedom of expression by carrying out activities that educate, inform, influence and support implementation of policies, laws and practices on the subject matter. This project will address the identified problem by constructively engaging relevant stakeholders on said subject; organizing information sessions, discussions and training for the judiciary and law enforcement agencies; organizing awareness training and workshops for media practitioners and ordinary citizens; employing effective advocacy strategies to ensure that proposed legislation that hurt freedom of expression are not passed; influencing the passage of positive rights legislation; utilizing the Freedom of Information Act to formally seek information regarding actual or potential freedom of expression infringements; instituting lawsuits against violators of online freedom of expression; and creating a systematic way of identifying, reporting and addressing violations of rights to freedom of expression online. The project is expected to significantly change the overall outlook towards digital engagement in Nigeria. It will reduce the climate of fear around freedom of expression online and will create safe spaces for dissidents, disadvantaged groups and minority groups who face huge discrimination on the basis of their opinion, beliefs or sexuality.

60 judges at different levels of Nigeria’s court system, 100 Law enforcements officers across different agencies and 100 civil society actors including the media. This project will employ strategic litigation to seek redress for at least 20 cases of violations of freedom of expression online rights in Nigeria and will work with the National Human Rights Commission to put in place a system of documenting and responding to violations of right to freedom of expression online.

activity-date.narrative:
RIPOTI: A web platform for reporting digital rights violations
The platform will be used to report, document and process human rights violations online. The development of the platform is ongoing. When completed, it will serve as a platform for intervention, research, and a safe place for whistleblowing around state induced clampdowns against freedom of expression

Civil Society Workshop, Uyo
We reached 45 Civil Society organizations in our 3-day workshop held in Uyo, Akwa-Ibom State, Nigeria. We incurred additional committed funds of 2,407,500.

Media Parleys
Two Media parleys were held. The first, a physical media parley in Lagos, Nigeria took place in January 2020 where we discussed the elements of the project with the media. The second parley couldn't hold physically because of Covid-19 imposed restriction. It was held virtually. We made use of committed funds of 3,406,494

Online Advertisement
We ran adverts on all our social media platforms and incurred the sum of 5,396,344.81 on Facebook, You tube and Instagram. We committed an additional sum of 7,807,500.

Traditional Media Advertisement
We ran newspaper advertisements on the proposed Social Medial Law in Nigeria. We also ran advertisements against civic restrictions as government implemented measures and lockdowns around Covid-19 and the #EndSars protest. We ran infomercials on 3 Radio Stations in Abuja for one week with a focus and messaging towards pushback on the anti-social media bill. We also committed an additional sum of 3,160,882.5

Media Fellowship
The Fellowship program is a 5-month program designed to immerse selected journalists in digital rights and digital inclusion advocacy and intervention efforts in Africa. Selected journalists (4) will work with Paradigm Initiative on various projects and contribute to improving media coverage of relevant issues. An additional sum of 810,000 was committed as stipends.

Digital Rights in Africa Report
The Digital Rights in Africa Report was released in March 2020. Building on previous reports published since 2016, the Digital Rights in Africa Report 2019 gives an in-depth analysis of the state of digital rights in Nigeria and Africa, and examines violations such as Internet disruptions, illegal surveillance, arrest of bloggers and the passage of hurtful legislation, amongst others. In addition to this we worked with a media company to convert the report into a short movie titled training day. The movie has grossed over 100000 views already. We have started work on the 2020 report. We announced a call for contributors and selected the best candidates with work expected to be completed to early 2021.

Equipment and Supplies
We purchased laptops for project staff and are supporting remote work.

Digital Rights Toolkit: AYETA
We incurred the costs on Production of Digital Rights Toolkit in Year 1; on Content Creation for 2,730,000, Design for 640,000 and Printing for 252,000. We also had committed funds of 3,076,500 for Printing.

Strategic Litigation
We prosecuted 10 cases via our partnership with Digital Rights Lawyers Initiative

Personnel
Cost of personnel for the reporting period.

DRIF 2020
Sunk cost towards hosting DRIF 2020

Audio Visual
The sum of 440,000 was incurred on scripting, while production and post-production attracted the sum of 1,200,000. We have also committed the sum of 4,947,750 into scripting and 1,552,500 for production and post-production. This commitment was made in November towards the projected cost of screening Training Day on International Human Rights Day.

Capacity Building for Project Officers and pro bono lawyers
Yearly training for Project Officers

Freedom Online Coalition 2020, 2021
Freedom Online Conference: The 2021 edition will be held in Finland later in the year. At least two Paradigm Initiative Staff will participate at the conference

Administrative
Administrative costs for the reporting period including Bank charges.
